citation.article-title: Bartonella japonica sp. nov. and Bartonella silvatica sp. nov., isolated from Apodemus mice
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bartonella silvatica sp. nov.
Bartonella silvatica [sil.va′ti.ca. L. fem. adj. silvatica of the forest where the host rodent, the large Japanese field mouse (Apodemus speciosus), from which the strain was isolated, was captured].
After 14 days incubation on HIA at 35 °C in a moist atmosphere under 5 % CO2, colonies appear small (1–2 mm in diameter), round, grey-whitish and smooth.
Cells are small bacilli without flagella or pili and are 1.16×0.43 μm.
Does not exhibit urease activity or hydrolyse trehalose.
Hydrolyses bis-p-nitrophenyl phosphate but not p-nitrophenyl N-acetyl β-d-glucosaminide.
Exhibits arylamidase activity towards leucine, methionine, lysine (alkaline as well as acidic), glycine, proline, arginine and tryptophan.
Glycylglycylarylamidase activity, but no pyrrolidonyl arylamidase activity.
Can be distinguished from other species of the genus Bartonella by the 16S rRNA, ftsZ, gltA, groEL, ribC and rpoB gene and ITS region sequences.
The type strain, Fuji 23-1T (=JCM 15566T=CIP 109862T), was isolated from the blood of Apodemus speciosus mice.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 40.4 mol%.
